p: Flavonoids are quite renowned for their anti-oxidant, hepatoprotective and anti-cancer potentials (Kumar and Pandey, 2013 ▶. Flavonoids are also known for their anti-inflammatory and allergic effect coupled with their gastric mucus production (Pan et al., 2010 ▶). Flavonoids possess some antibacterial and antifungal properties (Akpan et al., 2012 ▶; Mishra et al., 2013 ▶). It is safe to suggest that these bioactive compounds found in the plant stembark could be responsible for the various pharmacological activities of the plant and corroborate its widespread use in traditional medicine.
